page.title: 08Games Played in Southam
page.content: At school, a wide range of sporting activities are available. In winter rugby, football, netball and hockey are played while gymnastics are pursued indoors. Southam School has a sports hall where the above games can be played in bad weather. This hall is also used after school hours by the community for badminton clubs etc. Summer sports include rounders, cricket, tennis and athletics. Schools generally have a sports day when classes get together and compete against each other. Playground games differ from those played at home. British Bulldog is a favourite game. One child tries to catch another from a group as it passes him. If someone is caught, he then helps the first child. This continues until everyone is caught. "Tig" is another popular game.
